Sentence composed of 2 variables to describe how many reposts. In source English, the first variable is the number of reposts, and the second variable is 'Repost' or 'Reposts'. Sentence composed of 2 variables to describe how many people are following a user. In source English, the first variable is the number of followers, and the second variable is 'Follower' or 'Followers'.
Alert message that informs a user was muted.
When a note or profile is not found when searching for it via its note id
Reacted by heading in local notification

trans-unit.id: %@. Creating an account doesn't require a phone number, email or name. Get started right away with zero friction.

trans-unit.target: %@. Creating an account doesn't require a phone number, email or name. Get started right away with zero friction.

Dropdown option for selecting no translation service.
String indicating that a given timestamp just occurred
Prompt for user to enter in an account key to login. This text shows the characters the key could start with if it was a private key.
Label indicating that a form input is optional.

trans-unit.source: Only '%@' will see that you zapped them
trans-unit.target: Only '%@' will see that you zapped them
trans-unit.note: Description of private zap type where the zap is sent privately and does not identify the user to the public.

trans-unit.source: %@ reacted to a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.target: %@ reacted to a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.note: Notification that a user reacted to a post that the current user was tagged in

trans-unit.source: %@ and %@ reacted to a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.target: %@ and %@ reacted to a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.note: Notification that 2 users reacted to a post that the current user was tagged in
Notification that a user reacted to the current user's post
Notification that 2 users reacted to the current user's profile
Notification that a user reacted to the current user's profile
Notification that 2 users reacted to the current user's profile

trans-unit.source: %@ reposted a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.target: %@ reposted a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.note: Notification that a user reposted a post that the current user was tagged in

trans-unit.source: %@ and %@ reposted a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.target: %@ and %@ reposted a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.note: Notification that 2 users reposted a post that the current user was tagged in
Notification that a user reposted the current user's post
Notification that 2 users reposted the current user's post
Notification that a user reposted the current user's profile
Notification that 2 users reposted the current user's profile
Example username of Bitcoin creator(s), Satoshi Nakamoto.
Part of a larger sentence 'Replying to self' in US English. 'self' indicates that the user is replying to themself and no one else.
Placeholder example for relay server address.
You, in this context, is the person who controls their own social network. You is used in the context of a larger sentence that welcomes the reader to the social network that they control themself.

trans-unit.source: %@ zapped a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.target: %@ zapped a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.note: Notification that a user zapped a post that the current user was tagged in

trans-unit.source: %@ and %@ zapped a post you were tagged in
trans-unit.target: %@ and %@ zapped a post you were tagged in

Notification that a user zapped the current user's post
Notification that 2 users zapped the current user's post
Notification that a user zapped the current user's profile
Notification that 2 users zapped the current user's profile
Text indicating the zap amount. i.e. number of satoshis that were tipped to a user
